trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref uid="langword_csharp_My.Application.NetworkAvailabilityChanged" name="My.Application.NetworkAvailabilityChanged" href=""></xref> and <xref uid="langword_csharp_My.Computer.Network.NetworkAvailabilityChanged" name="My.Computer.Network.NetworkAvailabilityChanged" href=""></xref> events.

The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.NetworkAvailabilityChanged?displayProperty=fullName> and the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Network.NetworkAvailabilityChanged?displayProperty=fullName> events occur when the availability of the network changes.
NetworkAvailableEventArgs contains the new state of the network connection.
To get the current state of the network connection, use the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Network.IsAvailable%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.StartupNextInstanceEventArgs"></xref> class.

The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.NetworkAvailabilityChanged?displayProperty=fullName> and the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Network.NetworkAvailabilityChanged?displayProperty=fullName> events occur when the availability of the network changes.
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.NetworkAvailableEventArgs> contains the new state of the network connection.
To get the current state of the network connection, use the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Network.IsAvailable%2A> property.
A <xref:System.Boolean> that indicates whether a network is available to the application.
Gets a value indicating whether a network is available to the application.

The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.NetworkAvailabilityChanged?displayProperty=fullName> and the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Network.NetworkAvailabilityChanged?displayProperty=fullName> events occur when the availability of the network changes.
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.NetworkAvailableEventArgs> contains the new state of the network connection.
To get the current state of the network connection, use the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Network.IsAvailable%2A> property.
A <xref:System.Boolean> that indicates whether a network is available to the application.
